abstract: Conservatives and liberal Democrats alike are flooding Supreme Court with friend of the court legal briefs ahead of oral arguments in case King v Burwell, which is challenging payment of subsidies for health insurance in over 30 states in effort to overturn health care law; experts say briefs, which judges read carefully and may rely on, could influence outcome of case.
lead_paragraph: Amicus curiae, or friend of the court, briefs are flooding into the Supreme Court ahead of oral arguments March 4 that could determine the fate of the health care law.

headline.main: Flood of Briefs on the Health Care Law’s Subsidies Hits the Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Flood of Briefs on the Health Care Law’s Subsidies Hits the Supreme Court

snippet: Amicus curiae, or friend of the court, briefs are flooding into the Supreme Court ahead of oral arguments March 4 that could determine the fate of the health care law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
